result.execSummary:
The defendant Nelson Cruz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 37 (thirty-seven) days time served.
* If revoked: Huber release for work and Day Reporting Center (DRC). Court is not opposed to Interstate transfer.

miscConds.notes:
*   Court ordered DNA sample to be taken and DNA assessment to be paid.
*   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA) by February 11, 2019. Court WAIVED non-mandatory costs. Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
*  Court ordered restitution set at $0 (zero).
*  Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, education program, or combination of both.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

*  Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
*   No contact with victim Boyle F. or 840 N. Plankinton Avenue.
*   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or in the manner as prescribed.

*   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
*   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

*   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*   Maintain absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: With Huber for work and DRC in the House of Correction. This time is stayed to be used at the agent's discretion.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nelson Cruz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: no reply from defandant or surety. lj
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($1000.00) gj

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve 300 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 37 (thirty-seven) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 years. If revoked: Huber release for work and Day Reporting Center (DRC). Court is not opposed to Interstate transfer.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

     *   As a condition of probation, the Court ordered
          the defendant to serve 60 days with huber for
          work and DRC in the House of Correction. This 
          time is stayed to be used at the agent's discretion.
     *   Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *  Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, education program, or.
          combination of both.
     *   No contact with victim Boyle F. or 840 N. Plankinton Avenue.
     *   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription
          or in the manner as prescribed.
     *   Court ordered DNA sample to be taken and DNA assessment to be paid.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA) by February 11, 2019.
          Court WAIVED non-mandatory costs.
          Any remaining balance at the end of probation will be due  
          immediately or an entry of a civil judgment.
     *  Court ordered restitution set at $0 (zero).
.
Filed,

Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.

Defendant Nelson Cruz in court with attorney Christian Thomas.  Defendant Nelson Cruz in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY. Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

-Parties joint request for speedy projected guilty plea and sentencing GRANTED by the Court. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37 to February 10, 2017 at 8:30 a.m. March 7, 2017 at 8:30 a.m. projected guilty plea and sentencing date is VACATED.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Court ordered all previous conditions of bail to remain the same.

Attorney Travis Schwantes on behalf of Christian Thomas in court, defendant Nelson Cruz not in court, in custody and not produced.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Return on bench warrant held. Bail hearing proceeded. Arguments by counsel.  Defense requests Projected guilty plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 37. All parties are advised effective February 6, 2017 case will be in Room 512 of the Courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Per Jan at public defender's office is requesting sooner return on warrant.   Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 37 on February 2, 2017 at 1:30 p.m.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Case is adjourned for return on bench warrant in Branch 37 on February 6, 2017 at 8:30 a.m. Effective February 6, 2017 case will be in Room 512 of the Courthouse.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Justice Point Discharge Summary Report received and filed.

Attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub in court.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant fails to appear.  Court ordered a bench warrant issued, REMAND to Court and cash bail on deposit forfeited.

Defendant Nelson Cruz in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub. Megan Patricia Carmody for Jeremy Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Parties requested more time. State is in the middle of investigations. Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing 07/09/2015 received and filed. (22 pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to Christian Eichenlaub.

15RM032814  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
07-09-2015

Defendant Nelson Cruz in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Nelson Cruz in custody. Jeremy Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Keith Cameron-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Boyle F.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETYto be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Nelson Cruz in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub.  Defendant Nelson Cruz in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Nelson Cruz not in court.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 6/12/15 @ 1:30 pm
